issue.title: TryGetExtension fails for OpenAL EffectExtension

comment.body:
It seems to me that a proper fix would need to pass in the device for the current ALC context, like in ALContext, instead of `null` like I have above, which would just use the default context:
https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/blob/521e18a36ca4d91393814a1b4ae6a9494a91fd9b/src/OpenAL/Silk.NET.OpenAL/ALC/ALContext.cs#L31C10-L31C10

But that would make things a bit awkward..

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body: Forgot I fixed this in 2.18, closing :)

review.body: Thank you so much! The team didn't come up with strong arguments for or against an emergency patch being issued for this given that it's not our code, so I think I'll look into releasing this the first week of November and calling that the November update.

pull_request.title: Update ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3
pull_request.body:
# Summary of the PR
Updates ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3. This fixes `System.MissingMethodException` occurring whenever an ImGui method with a non-ref string parameter is called. The following fix is included in the new ImGui.NET version: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/pull/439

The [Silk.NET ImGui sample](https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/tree/main/examples/CSharp/OpenGL%20Demos/ImGui) currently fails on main, but works correctly on this branch. I've also tested some of my own projects. Everything runs correctly on both .NET Standard 2.0 and .NET 7.0. (I have not explicitly tested .NET 6.0 but I do not expect any issues there.)

# Related issues, Discord discussions, or proposals
https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/issues/436
https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/issues/1757

# Further Comments
The `CmdListsRange` -> `CmdLists` change is unrelated. `CmdListsRange` is no longer needed and no longer exists: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/commit/ab3011592e412aeca489b1e5485b5dad340e8bd6

Please let me know if there's anything else I missed, and apologies for not realizing the impact of this issue before Silk.NET 2.18.0 released.

issue.title: Update ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3
issue.body:
# Summary of the PR
Updates ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3. This fixes `System.MissingMethodException` occurring whenever an ImGui method with a non-ref string parameter is called. The following fix is included in the new ImGui.NET version: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/pull/439

The [Silk.NET ImGui sample](https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/tree/main/examples/CSharp/OpenGL%20Demos/ImGui) currently fails on main, but works correctly on this branch. I've also tested some of my own projects. Everything runs correctly on both .NET Standard 2.0 and .NET 7.0. (I have not explicitly tested .NET 6.0 but I do not expect any issues there.)

# Related issues, Discord discussions, or proposals
https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/issues/436
https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/issues/1757

# Further Comments
The `CmdListsRange` -> `CmdLists` change is unrelated. `CmdListsRange` is no longer needed and no longer exists: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/commit/ab3011592e412aeca489b1e5485b5dad340e8bd6

Please let me know if there's anything else I missed, and apologies for not realizing the impact of this issue before Silk.NET 2.18.0 released.

comment.body:
> We don't maintain ImGuiVulkan, so I'm not worried about that (we're still waiting for a community contributor to brush it up to the same standard as the OpenGL ones)
> 
> The validation layers requested error usually means you don't have the Vulkan SDK installed, but also that code just needs to be removed outright as that's no longer the recommended way to use validation layers.

Alright, thanks. The build should succeed now. If more changes are needed I'll look into it tomorrow.

issue.title: Update ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3
issue.body:
# Summary of the PR
Updates ImGui.NET from 1.89.7.1 to 1.89.9.3. This fixes `System.MissingMethodException` occurring whenever an ImGui method with a non-ref string parameter is called. The following fix is included in the new ImGui.NET version: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/pull/439

The [Silk.NET ImGui sample](https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/tree/main/examples/CSharp/OpenGL%20Demos/ImGui) currently fails on main, but works correctly on this branch. I've also tested some of my own projects. Everything runs correctly on both .NET Standard 2.0 and .NET 7.0. (I have not explicitly tested .NET 6.0 but I do not expect any issues there.)

# Related issues, Discord discussions, or proposals
https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/issues/436
https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/issues/1757

# Further Comments
The `CmdListsRange` -> `CmdLists` change is unrelated. `CmdListsRange` is no longer needed and no longer exists: https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/commit/ab3011592e412aeca489b1e5485b5dad340e8bd6

Please let me know if there's anything else I missed, and apologies for not realizing the impact of this issue before Silk.NET 2.18.0 released.

comment.body:
We don't maintain ImGuiVulkan, so I'm not worried about that (we're still waiting for a community contributor to brush it up to the same standard as the OpenGL ones)

The validation layers requested error usually means you don't have the Vulkan SDK installed, but also that code just needs to be removed outright as that's no longer the recommended way to use validation layers.
Is this the correct way of doing things? I'm not sure.

comment.body:
> Build seems to be failing
> 
> ```
>   [ERR] Pack: /Users/runner/work/Silk.NET/Silk.NET/src/Lab/Experiments/ImGuiVulkan/Lib/ImGuiController.cs(833,44): error CS0021: Cannot apply indexing with [] to an expression of type 'ImVector' [/Users/runner/work/Silk.NET/Silk.NET/src/Lab/Experiments/ImGuiVulkan/ImGuiVulkan.csproj]
>   [ERR] Pack: /Users/runner/work/Silk.NET/Silk.NET/src/Lab/Experiments/ImGuiVulkan/Lib/ImGuiController.cs(899,48): error CS0021: Cannot apply indexing with [] to an expression of type 'ImVector' [/Users/runner/work/Silk.NET/Silk.NET/src/Lab/Experiments/ImGuiVulkan/ImGuiVulkan.csproj]
> ```

Ah I missed that, I didn't have Vulkan included in my generated solution. The build succeeds on my machine now, but ImGuiVulkan crashes at runtime:

```
Unhandled exception. System.NotSupportedException: Validation layers requested, but not available! 
```

I'm not sure what this means.

```

issue.title: Update ImGui.NET from 1.88.0 to 1.89.7.1
issue.body:
# Summary of the PR
Updates ImGui.NET from 1.88.0 to 1.89.7.1 (latest)

# Related issues, Discord discussions, or proposals
N/A

# Further Comments
The latest versions of ImGui.NET allow users to pass `ReadOnlySpan<char>` instead of `string` on platforms where `ReadOnlySpan` is supported, saving GC overhead in UI render loops.

The main reason why I'd like to use this is so I can write allocation-free UI code so actual memory allocations happening in my engine are easier to spot. 🙂

I'm also curious if it would be possible to get a pre-release version released for `Silk.NET.OpenGL.Extensions.ImGui`. If that's normally not done, that's fine. I don't mind waiting for the next release.

Please let me know if I've missed anything.

comment.body:
> This PR might cause crash for the imgui sample project.
> 
> ```
> System.MissingMethodException:   
> 'Method not found: 'ImGuiNET.ImFontPtr  
> ImGuiNET.ImFontAtlasPtr.AddFontFromFileTTF(System.String, Single, ImGuiNET.ImFontConfigPtr, IntPtr)'.'
> ```
> 
> Reference a ImGui.NET comment for the discussion: [ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET#412 (comment)](https://github.com/ImGuiNET/ImGui.NET/pull/412#issuecomment-1763295315)

@fantasydr This PR fixes it: https://github.com/dotnet/Silk.NET/pull/1758

All my tests are working as expected. Please let me know if you run into any other related problems with ImGui.NET. Thanks.
